Septic Tank Meledak, Berapa Harga Ganti Baru?
07 Nov 2019, 02:57 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Ilustrasi septic tank (iStockphoto)

Jakarta - Seorang petugas sedot WC meninggal dunia ketika septic tank yang ditanganinya di rumah pelanggan di daerah Cakung, Jakarta Timur meledak. Petugas berinisial SI tersebut diketahui membakar koran di lubang septic tank untuk membuktikan tidak ada gas tersisa.Polisi menyatakan bahwa ledakan tersebut terjadi akibat gas yang mengendap selama puluhan tahun. Ledakan tersebut menyebabkan septic tank itu hancur lebur. Menarik untuk tahu, setelah rusak dan meledak, berapa harga dan biaya pasang septic tank baru.Mengutip sebuah situs jasa pemasangan fasilitas sanitasi, septic tank berjenis sewage dengan ukuran 4,5 meter kubik dan kapasitas 4.500 liter dibanderol dengan harga Rp 7.500.000. "7,5 juta terima rapi. Pemasangan 1-2 hari," bunyi keterangan yang diterima detikcom dari jasa pelayanan fasilitas sanitasi tersebut, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Selain itu, dikutip dari laman marketplace Tokopedia, sebuah septic tank dengan jenis biofilter (BF) berkapasitas 3.000 liter dibanderol dengan harga Rp 7.350.000. "Septic Tank BF 3000 adalah septic tank ramah lingkungan yang sudah dirancang khusus sebagai pengganti septic tank konvensional," bunyi keterangan produk dari laman tersebut.Adapun perbedaan septic tank konvensional dengan septic tank biofilter seperti yang dikutip detikcom dari berbagai sumber sebagai berikut:1. Septic tank konvensionalSeptic tank ini yang biasa digunakan oleh rumah tangga terdiri dari dua kompartemen. Ruangan pertama berfungsi sebagai ruang pembusukan limbah dan tangki kedua sebagai tempat pengendapan lumpur yang tersisa.
2. Septic tank biofilterSeptic tank ini dijelaskan oleh ahli kesehatan lingkungan sekaligus konsultan pengolahan limbah Abie Wiwoho terdiri atas empat kompartemen. Dua kompartemen pertama sama seperti yang ada di septic tank konvensional ditambah dua kompartemen tambahan berisi media yang berfungsi sebagai filter.Dengan septic tank ini limbah yang dihasilkan bisa lebih jernih karena proses penguraian oleh bakteri dan saringan.

Exploded Septic Tank, How Much Is the Price of a New Change?
07 Nov 2019, 02:57 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Illustration of septic tank (iStockPhoto)

Jakarta - A toilet suction officer died when the septic tank he was handling at a customer's house in the Cakung area, East Jakarta exploded. The official with the initials SI was known to have burned a newspaper in a septic tank to prove there was no gas left. The police claimed that the explosion had occurred due to gas that had been settling for decades. The explosion caused the septic tank to be destroyed. It is interesting to know, after being damaged and exploded, what is the price and cost of installing a new septic tank. To quote a site for the installation of sanitation facilities, a septic tank of sewage type with a size of 4.5 cubic meters and a capacity of 4,500 liters is priced at Rp 7,500,000. "7.5 million received neatly. Installation of 1-2 days," said a statement received by AFP from the sanitation facility services, Thursday (11/07/2019).
In addition, quoted from the Tokopedia marketplace page, a septic tank with a type of biofilter (BF) with a capacity of 3,000 liters is priced at Rp 7,350,000. "BF 3000 Septic Tank is an environmentally friendly septic tank that has been specifically designed as a substitute for conventional septic tanks," reads the product's description from the page. Conventional septic tank This common tank used by households consists of two compartments. The first room serves as a waste spoilage chamber and the second tank as a place for settling the remaining mud.
2. This septic tank biofilterSeptic tank is explained by an environmental health expert and waste treatment consultant Abie Wiwoho consisting of four compartments. The first two compartments are the same as those in conventional septic tanks plus two additional compartments containing media that function as filters. With this septic tank the resulting waste can be clearer because of the decomposition process by bacteria and filters.
